header.title: The art of drawing spirits into crystals

central_thesis: This text provides a comprehensive, Christianized ceremonial magic system for the preparation and ritualistic use of a consecrated crystal to invoke and communicate with angelic and planetary spirits, primarily to gain divinely sanctioned knowledge, healing, and beneficial insights.

structure_content.chapter_title: Of the making of the Chrystal and the Form of Preparation for a Vision
structure_content.summary: Detailed instructions for crafting and consecrating the primary magical instrument, the crystal, including its physical specifications, the associated gold plate with divine and angelic names, and the design of its pedestal and the magical table upon which it rests, adorned with planetary and angelic sigils.

Guidance on the operational phase, emphasizing the observance of planetary hours, a preparatory prayer seeking divine strength and clarity of spiritual vision, and the consecration of the magic circle and perfumes to ensure a safe and pure environment for spirit manifestation.

Describes the specific invocation formula addressing a chosen angel (e.g., Michael), the process of questioning the manifested spirit about its identity, office, sign, and favorable times, and the subsequent ritual for its peaceful and divinely sanctioned dismissal, along with instructions for recording all revealed information.
A tabular breakdown listing the specific angelic and planetary rulers for each of the twelve hours of day and night, for every day of the week, crucial for timing magical operations.

An explanation of how to calculate planetary hours, emphasizing that they are not fixed sixty-minute intervals but are determined by dividing the period between sunrise and sunset (or sunset and sunrise) into twelve equal parts, which vary with the seasons.

key_concepts.definition: The central magical practice involving gazing into a specially prepared, clear, globular crystal to perceive and communicate with spirits, which are expected to manifest visibly within it.

Divisions of the day and night into twelve equal, variable periods, each ruled by a specific planet and its associated angel. Operations are timed to align with the ruling entity corresponding to the desired spirit.
A powerful Hebrew divine name, engraved on the crystal's gold plate and invoked in prayers, signifying divine authority and used for consecration and spirit summoning.
Specific angels (e.g., Michael, Gabriel, Uriel, Raphael, Sachiel, Samiel, Cassiel) associated with planetary spheres, invoked as intermediaries or direct agents in the magical operations.

The ritualistic purification and blessing of all magical tools, the crystal, and the operating space (magic circle and table) to render them sacred and efficacious for interaction with spiritual entities, often invoking the Holy Trinity and divine names.
A protective boundary traced on the ground by the operator, consecrated to prevent malevolent spirits from entering and to ensure the operator's safety during evocation.
A consecrated magical talisman, either drawn on parchment or engraved on silver, worn around the neck for protection and to empower the operator.
The ritual burning of perfumes or incense in a vessel or tripod, intended to create a suitable atmosphere for spirit manifestation, purify the space, and remove 'phantasms' or illusions.

practical_system.description: The system outlines a method for direct communication with planetary angels through crystal scrying, emphasizing extensive preparation, ritual purity, and precise timing. The practitioner constructs and consecrates a crystal, pedestal, and magical table, and uses other consecrated tools within a protected circle. The operation involves a series of prayers and invocations to compel an angel to manifest visibly in the crystal to answer questions or bestow 'good gifts,' while strictly avoiding unlawful knowledge and maintaining a pious demeanor.
tools: Clear pellucid crystal (approx. 1.5 inches diameter, globular)
Small plate of pure gold (to encompass half the crystal, engraved with characters, 'Tetragrammaton', 'Michael, Gabriel, Uriel, Raphael')
Ivory or ebony pedestal for the crystal
Magical table/altar (with names of seven planets and ruling angels, their seals/characters, and names of four kings of the four corners of the earth, drawn within a double circle with a triangle)
Pentacle (on virgin parchment or silver plate, suspended from neck)
Vessel for perfumes/incense (and/or 'The Tripod' from illustrations)
Little book (approx. 7 inches long, made of pure white virgin vellum or paper)
The Lamen, or Holy Table of the Archangel Michael (from illustrations)
rituals: Obtaining and consecrating a clear, globular crystal of specific dimensions.
Preparing a gold plate for the crystal engraved with divine names ('Tetragrammaton') and the names of four principal angels (Michael, Gabriel, Uriel, Raphael).
Mounting the crystal on an ivory or ebony pedestal.
Constructing and inscribing a magical table with names of seven planets, their ruling angels, seals, and the four kings of the four corners of the earth, within a double circle and a triangle.
Observing the correct planetary hour for the desired spirit's influence.
Reciting a preliminary prayer for divine strength, clear spiritual sight, and sanctification of the crystal.
Wearing a consecrated ring on the right little finger and a pentacle around the neck.
Tracing and consecrating a magic circle with a black ebony wand, appealing to the Holy Trinity for defense.
Placing a vessel for perfumes between the circle and the table, casting in perfumes while consecrating the fire.
Invoking the desired planetary angel (e.g., Michael) by name, appealing to the Holy Trinity and Tetragrammaton, requesting visible manifestation in the crystal.
Interrogating the spirit about its true name, office, sign/character, and agreeable times for conference.
Recording all information revealed by the spirit in a dedicated magical book.
Thanking the spirit and dismissing it peacefully, invoking the name of Jesus Christ.
Concluding with a prayer of glory to God.

relevant_quotes.text: Procure of a lapidary good clear pellucid crystal, of the bigness of a small orange, i.e. about one inch and a half in diameter; let it be globular or round each way alike;

Oh, God! who art the author of all good things, strengthen, I beseech thee, thy poor servant, that he may stand fast, without fear, through this dealing and work; enlighten, I beseech thee, oh Lord! the dark understanding of thy creature, so that his spiritual eye may be opened to see and know thy angelic spirits descending here in this crystal:

In the name of the blessed Trinity, I consecrate this piece of ground for our defence; so that no evil spirit may have power to break these bounds prescribed here, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

I conjure thee, oh thou creature of fire! by him who created all things both in heaven and earth, and in the sea, and in every other place whatever, that forthwith thou cast away every phantasm from thee, that no hurt whatsoever shall be done in any thing.

In the name of the blessed and holy Trinity, I do desire thee, thou strong mighty angel, Michael, [Or any other angel or spirit] that if it be the divine will of him who is called Tetragrammaton &c. the Holy God, the Father, that thou take upon thee some shape as best becometh thy celestial nature, and appear to us visibly here in this crystal, and answer our demands in as far as we shall not transgress the bounds of the divine mercy and goodness, by requesting unlawful knowledge;

Note, The day is divided into twelve equal parts, called Planetary Hours, reckoning from sunsire to sunset, and, again, from the setting to the rising; and to find the planetary hour, you need but to divide the natural hours by twelve, and the quotient gives the length of the planetary hours and odd minutes, which shews you how long a spirit bears rule in that day;

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is a classic example of Renaissance grimoire tradition, particularly influencing Hermetic and Christian Qabalistic magic. It details a system of angelic evocation through scrying that emphasizes purity, piety, and adherence to divine will, contrasting with more Faustian or Goetic approaches. Its detailed instructions on planetary hours and tool consecration laid groundwork for subsequent ceremonial magic practices. Although a concluding note suggests its spurious attribution to Trithemius, it embodies the Trithemian legacy of integrating angelic magic with learned occultism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Practitioners of ceremonial magic, scholars of Western Esotericism and occult history, students of grimoire traditions, and individuals interested in the historical and practical aspects of angelic communication and crystal scrying within a Christian magical framework.
